title: Adele shows off new look in stunning gown at Drake's party: 'I used to cry but now I sweat'
text:
CLOSE Sad news from Adele. The extremely private superstar confirms she and her husband Simon Konecki have separated. Nathan Rousseau Smith has the details. Buzz60

Adele looked flawless at Drake's 33rd birthday party Wednesday in a strapless black, velvet dress that made everyone want to say Hello.

The Grammy-winning singer paired her stunning gown with a black belt cinched around her waist, showcasing her svelte new figure as she partied the night away. Silver statement earrings, a high ponytail and black strappy heels completed her look.

As for her transformation? "I used to cry but now I sweat," the singer, 31, wrote on Instagram Thursday, along with the crying-laughing emoji. She added, "Happy birthday to one of the kindest and funniest people I’ve met @champagnepapi."

More: Nicki Minaj says she was being 'sarcastic' about Adele collaboration

Omg Adele last night at Drake’s party 😧 pic.twitter.com/t8elqNmx60 — colyn elliott (@ColynElliott) October 24, 2019

On her own 31st birthday in May, Adele talked about her evolution on Instagram, revealing that she's "changed drastically in the last couple years and I’m still changing."

Adele and her entrepreneur/philanthropist husband Simon Konecki announced their split a month earlier in April. They share 7-year-old son Angelo.

Following her breakup, the singer committed to spending the year "all on myself." She added, "For the first time in a decade I’m ready to feel the world around me and look up for once… Learning to REALLY truly love yourself is it, and I’ve only just realized that that is more than enough."

More: Adele breaks silence after split with husband, shows full range of Instagram heartbreak

In her post, Adele advised everyone to "be kind to yourself" and "laugh out loud at every opportunity," which we are sure she did plenty of at Drake's star-studded birthday bash.

Adele and Drake have been friends for some time. Last October, she dropped by his Aubrey & the Three Migos concert in Los Angeles and was seriously impressed.

"Oiii Champagne Papi blew my mind tonight!" she tweeted. "Best production I’ve ever seen hands down and way up there with one of my favorite shows of all time. Huge love."

Oiii Champagne Papi blew my mind tonight! Best production I’ve ever seen hands down and way up there with one of my favorite shows of all time. Huge love ❤️ — Adele (@Adele) October 13, 2018

The feeling was mutual. "Oiiiiiii don’t (expletive) get me gassed right now I love this woman and she came to the show," Drake wrote on Instagram last October after reposting Adele's tweet. "Thank god nobody told me I would have been SHOOK."
